p.s: Shakespeare's works are outdated in my mind.
I often hear people praising him for his great poetry or use of language as well as the stories portrayed through his plays however in my mind his works are overrated.
Sure Shakespeare was a good writer for his time however his works just seem outdated and seemingly have no significant relevance today.
In my mind there is just no reason to read a piece of litearture in Elizabethan English as this language is just obsolete and of no use today.
Surely you can see from what the modern English language developed and its origin through words such as thee that are similar to German.
Although the development of a language might interest many people it is not relevant for the modern form of the language.
Furthermore I do not find Shakespeare's stories to be that relevant.

Romeo and Juliet seems to be the basis to many modern love stories, however, modern love stories might just be similar because they are love stories as well and therefore also tell the story of two lovers.
Furthermore Romeo and Juliet is not even Shakespeare's own creation, there was a similar story before, consisting of Romeo and Juliet.
Still it has to be said that Shakespeare's version Romeo and Juliet was and still is far more succesful.

Shakespeare is definitely a good writer and his stories are good pieces of literary, though I do not see them as relevant just because they are written well ar 400 years old to me works such as George Orwell's 1984 seem far more relevant as they deal with a more relevant topic for modern society.
